metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3718 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) HTTP and (2) FTP coders in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.x before 7.0.1-1 allow remote attackers to conduct server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks via a crafted image. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.24-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.24-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.24-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.24-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.24-1
No subscription required

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libimage-magick-q16hdri-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagick++-6.q16-7 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagick++-6.q16hdri-7 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6.q16-3 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6.q16-3-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-3 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-3-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickwand-6.q16-3 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
libmagickwand-6.q16hdri-3 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.24-1').
imagemagick package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu7').
